metadata.title: The PATH Environment Variable For Root Must Contain Absolute Paths
metadata.description: The PATH environment variable for root must contain absolute paths.

environment variable PATH contains : twice in a row
environment variable PATH contains . twice in a row
environment variable PATH ends with : or .
environment variable PATH doesn't begin with a /
environment variable PATH doesn't contain relative paths

metadata.title: Ignore ICMPv6 Echo Requests On a Broadcast Address.
metadata.description: Add Drop Rule for the INPUT built-in chain to ignore any ICMPv6 echo requests sent to a broadcast address.

metadata.title: The system must not have 6to4 enabled.
metadata.description: 6to4 is an IPv6 transition mechanism involving tunnelling IPv6 packets encapsulated in IPv4 packets on an ad-hoc basis. This is not a preferred transition strategy and increases the attack surface of the system.

metadata.title: The system must not have Teredo enabled.
metadata.description: Teredo is an IPv6 transition mechanism involving tunneling IPv6 packets encapsulated in IPv4 packets. Unauthorized tunneling may circumvent network security.

metadata.title: The system must not have IP tunnels configured.
metadata.description: IP tunneling mechanisms can be used to bypass network filtering.

metadata.title: Add Reject Rule for the INPUT built-in chain
metadata.description: Add a reject rule for the INPUT built-in chain.

metadata.title: Add Reject Rule Timestamp Requests and Timestamp Replies
metadata.description: Add Reject Rule Timestamp Requests and Timestamp Replies.

metadata.title: Disable appletalk Kernel Module
metadata.description: The kernel module appletalk should be disabled.

metadata.title: Disable bluetooth Kernel Module
metadata.description: The kernel module bluetooth should be disabled.

metadata.title: Disable bridge Kernel Module
metadata.description: The kernel module bridge should be disabled.

metadata.title: Disable dccp Kernel Module
metadata.description: The kernel module dccp should be disabled.

metadata.title: Disable ieee1394 Kernel Module
metadata.description: The kernel module ieee1394 should be disabled.

metadata.title: Disable IPv6 Kernel Module Functionality via Disable Option
metadata.description: The kernel module ipv6 should be disabled.

metadata.title: Disable rds Kernel Module
metadata.description: The kernel module rds should be disabled.

metadata.title: Disable sctp Kernel Module
metadata.description: The kernel module sctp should be disabled.

metadata.title: Disable tipc Kernel Module
metadata.description: The kernel module tipc should be disabled.

metadata.title: Disable usb-storage Kernel Module
metadata.description: The kernel module usb-storage should be disabled.

metadata.title: Ensure LDAP Does Not Store Passwords In Clear Text
metadata.description: If the system is using LDAP for authentication or account information, the /etc/ldap.conf file (or equivalent) must not contain passwords.

metadata.title: Configure LDAP to Use TLS for All Transactions
metadata.description: Require the use of TLS for ldap clients.

metadata.title: Configure LDAP to Use Approved TLS Certificate
metadata.description: If the system is using LDAP for authentication or account information, certificates used to authenticate to the LDAP server must be provided from DoD PKI or a DoD-approved external PKI.

metadata.title: Configure LDAP To Require Trusted CA
metadata.description: If the system is using LDAP for authentication or account information, the LDAP TLS connection must require the server provide a certificate with a valid trust path to a trusted CA.

metadata.title: Configure LDAP To Require Verifying Certificate Revocation
metadata.description: If the system is using LDAP for authentication or account information, the system must verify the LDAP server's certificate has not been revoked.

metadata.title: Ensure All Logs are Rotated by logrotate
metadata.description: The logrotate (syslog rotater) service should be enabled.

metadata.title: SMTP DEBUG Command Disabled
metadata.description: The sendmail server must have the debug feature disabled.

criterion.comment: Installed version of sendmail is greater than 8.13.8-8

metadata.title: SMTP DECODE Command Disabled
metadata.description: The SMTP service must not have a uudecode alias active.

criterion.comment: decode and uudecode in /etc/aliases should not include file paths

metadata.title: SMTP EXPN Command Disabled
metadata.description: The SMTP service must not have the EXPN feature active.

metadata.title: SMTP Mail Forwarding Disabled
metadata.description: The system must not use .forward files.

metadata.title: SMTP HELP Command Disabled
metadata.description: The SMTP service HELP command must not be enabled.

metadata.title: SMTP Logging Enabled
metadata.description: The system syslog service must log informational and more severe SMTP service messages.

metadata.title: Sendmail Log Level
metadata.description: Sendmail logging must not be set to less than nine in the sendmail.cf file.

metadata.title: Postfix network listening should be disabled
metadata.description: Postfix network listening should be disabled.

metadata.title: SMTP Service Updated
metadata.description: The SMTP service must be an up-to-date version.

criterion.comment: Installed version of postfix is greater than 2.3.3-6
Installed version of sendmail is greater than 8.13.8-8

metadata.title: SMTP Version Info Must Not Be Advertised
metadata.description: The SMTP service's SMTP greeting must not provide version information.

metadata.title: SMTP VRFY Command Disabled
metadata.description: The SMTP service must not have the Verify (VRFY) feature active.

metadata.title: SMTP WIZ Command Disabled
metadata.description: The sendmail service must not have the wizard backdoor active.

criterion.comment: Installed version of sendmail is greater than 8.13.8-8

metadata.title: Disable DHCP Client
metadata.description: DHCP configuration should be static for all interfaces.

criteria.comment: Test for IPV6_DEFAULTGW across all interfaces if IPV6 is enabled

metadata.title: The IPv6 Protocol Binding.
metadata.description: The IPv6 protocol handler must not be bound to the network stack unless needed.

metadata.title: NFS Restrict Local Access
metadata.description: The Network File System (NFS) server must be configured to restrict file system access to local hosts.

criterion.comment: make sure ro or rw options are used in /etc/exports

metadata.title: All NFS Mounts Have NOSUID Option
metadata.description: The nosuid option must be enabled on all Network File System (NFS) client mounts.

metadata.title: NFS Anonymous IDs Configured Appropriately
metadata.description: The Network File System (NFS) anonymous UID and GID must be configured to values without permissions.

criterion.comment: make sure anonuid and anongid options are used in /etc/exports

metadata.title: No insecure_locks Option in /etc/exports
metadata.description: Insecure file locking could allow for sensitive data to be viewed or edited by an unauthorized user.

criterion.comment: make sure the insecure_locks option is not used in /etc/exports

metadata.title: No Remote Root NFS Access
metadata.description: The Network File System (NFS) server must not allow remote root access.

criterion.comment: root_squash or all_squash is used for each nfs mount in /etc/exports

metadata.title: No nullok Option in /etc/pam.d/system-auth
metadata.description: The file /etc/pam.d/system-auth should not contain the nullok option

criterion.comment: make sure the nullok option is not used in /etc/pam.d/system-auth
make sure the nullok option is not used in /etc/pam.d/system-auth-ac

metadata.title: Ensure /home Located On Separate Partition
metadata.description: If user home directories will be stored locally, create a separate partition for /home. If /home will be mounted from another system such as an NFS server, then creating a separate partition is not necessary at this time, and the mountpoint can instead be configured later.

metadata.title: Ensure /tmp Located On Separate Partition
metadata.description: The /tmp directory is a world-writable directory used for temporary file storage. Verify that it has its own partition or logical volume.

metadata.title: Ensure /var Located On Separate Partition
metadata.description: Ensuring that /var is mounted on its own partition enables the setting of more restrictive mount options, which is used as temporary storage by many program, particularly system services such as daemons. It is not uncommon for the /var directory to contain world-writable directories, installed by other software packages.

metadata.title: Ensure /var/log/audit Located On Separate Partition
metadata.description: Audit logs are stored in the /var/log/audit directory. Ensure that it has its own partition or logical volume. Make absolutely certain that it is large enough to store all audit logs that will be created by the auditing daemon.

metadata.title: Require Authentication for Single-User Mode
metadata.description: The requirement for a password to boot into single-user mode should be configured correctly.

metadata.title: Special Privilege Accounts Must Not Exist
metadata.description: If special privilege accounts are compromised, the accounts could provide privileges to execute malicious commands on a system.

metadata.title: Ftp Account Must Not Exist
metadata.description: The system must not have the unnecessary "ftp" account.

metadata.title: Games Account Must Not Exist
metadata.description: The system must not have the unnecessary "games" account.

metadata.title: Gopher Account Must Not Exist

metadata.title: Disable Printer Browsing Entirely if Possible
metadata.description: The CUPS print service can be configured to broadcast a list of available printers to the network. Other machines on the network, also running the CUPS print service, can be configured to listen to these broadcasts and add and configure these printers for immediate use. By disabling this browsing capability, the machine will no longer generate or receive such broadcasts.

criterion.comment: Ensure remote printer browsing is off
Ensure no incoming printer information packets are allowed

metadata.title: Disable Printer Server if Possible
metadata.description: By default, locally configured printers will not be shared over the network, but if this functionality has somehow been enabled, these recommendations will disable it again. Be sure to disable outgoing printer list broadcasts, or remote users will still be able to see the locally configured printers, even if they cannot actually print to them. To limit print serving to a particular set of users, use the Policy directive.

metadata.title: Check if the scan target is a container
metadata.description: Check if file /.dockerenv exists, if it does then we consider to be a docker filesystem.

metadata.title: Check if the scan target is a machine
metadata.description: Check if file /.dockerenv exists, if it doesn't then we consider to be host filesystem or virtual machine.

metadata.title: Ensure Logwatch HostLimit Configured
metadata.description: Test if HostLimit line in logwatch.conf is set appropriately.

metadata.title: Ensure Logwatch SplitHosts Configured
metadata.description: Check if SplitHosts line in logwatch.conf is set appropriately.

metadata.title: Add nodev Option to /dev/shm
metadata.description: Legitimate character and block devices should not exist within temporary directories like /dev/shm. The nodev mount option should be specified for /dev/shm.

metadata.title: Add noexec Option to /dev/shm
metadata.description: It can be dangerous to allow the execution of binaries from world-writable temporary storage directories such as /dev/shm. The noexec mount option prevents binaries from being executed out of /dev/shm.

metadata.title: Add nosuid Option to /dev/shm
metadata.description: The nosuid mount option should be set for temporary storage partitions such as /dev/shm. The suid/sgid permissions should not be required in these world-writable directories.

metadata.title: Add nodev Option to Non-Root Local Partitions
metadata.description: The nodev mount option prevents files from being interpreted as character or block devices. Legitimate character and block devices should exist in the /dev directory on the root partition or within chroot jails built for system services. All other locations should not allow character and block devices.

metadata.title: Mount Remote Filesystems with nodev
metadata.description: The nodev option should be enabled for all NFS mounts in /etc/fstab.

metadata.title: Add nodev Option to Removable Media Partitions
metadata.description: The nodev mount option prevents files from being interpreted as character or block devices. Legitimate character and block devices should exist in the /dev directory on the root partition or within chroot jails built for system services. All other locations should not allow character and block devices.

extend_definition.comment: Check if removable partition really exists on the system
Check if removable partition value represents CD/DVD drive

criterion.comment: Check if at least one from CD/DVD drive alternative names is using 'nodev' mount option in /etc/fstab
Check if at least one from CD/DVD drive alternative names is using 'nodev' mount option in runtime configuration
Check if removable partition is using 'nodev' mount option in /etc/fstab
Check if removable partition is using 'nodev' mount option in runtime configuration

metadata.title: Add noexec Option to Removable Media Partitions
metadata.description: The noexec mount option prevents the direct execution of binaries on the mounted filesystem. Users should not be allowed to execute binaries that exist on partitions mounted from removable media (such as a USB key). The noexec option prevents code from being executed directly from the media itself, and may therefore provide a line of defense against certain types of worms or malicious code.

extend_definition.comment: Check if removable partition really exists on the system
Check if removable partition value represents CD/DVD drive

criterion.comment: Check if at least one from CD/DVD drive alternative names is using 'noexec' mount option in /etc/fstab
Check if at least one from CD/DVD drive alternative names is using 'noexec' mount option in runtime configuration
Check if removable partition is using 'noexec' mount option in /etc/fstab
Check if removable partition is using 'noexec' mount option in runtime configuration

metadata.title: Mount Remote Filesystems with nosuid
metadata.description: The nosuid option should be enabled for all NFS mounts in /etc/fstab.

metadata.title: Add nosuid Option to Removable Media Partitions
metadata.description: The nosuid mount option prevents set-user-identifier (suid) and set-group-identifier (sgid) permissions from taking effect. These permissions allow users to execute binaries with the same permissions as the owner and group of the file respectively. Users should not be allowed to introduce suid and guid files into the system via partitions mounted from removeable media.

extend_definition.comment: Check if removable partition really exists on the system
Check if removable partition value represents CD/DVD drive

criterion.comment: Check if at least one from CD/DVD drive alternative names is using 'nosuid' mount option in /etc/fstab
Check if at least one from CD/DVD drive alternative names is using 'nosuid' mount option in runtime configuration
Check if removable partition is using 'nosuid' mount option in /etc/fstab
Check if removable partition is using 'nosuid' mount option in runtime configuration

metadata.title: Require Client SMB Packet Signing, if using mount.cifs
metadata.description: Require packet signing of clients who mount Samba shares using the mount.cifs program (e.g., those who specify shares in /etc/fstab). To do so, ensure that signing options (either sec=krb5i or sec=ntlmv2i) are used.

criterion.comment: check for sec=krb5i or sec=ntlmv2i in /etc/fstab
check for sec=krb5i or sec=ntlmv2i in /etc/mtab

metadata.title: Add nodev Option to /tmp
metadata.description: Legitimate character and block devices should not exist within temporary directories like /tmp. The nodev mount option should be specified for /tmp.

metadata.title: Add noexec Option to /tmp
metadata.description: It can be dangerous to allow the execution of binaries from world-writable temporary storage directories such as /tmp. The noexec mount option prevents binaries from being executed out of /tmp.

metadata.title: Add nosuid Option to /tmp
metadata.description: The nosuid mount option should be set for temporary storage partitions such as /tmp. The suid/sgid permissions should not be required in these world-writable directories.

metadata.title: Bind Mount /var/tmp To /tmp
metadata.description: The /var/tmp directory should be bind mounted to /tmp in order to consolidate temporary storage into one location protected by the same techniques as /tmp.

metadata.title: Disable Zeroconf Networking
metadata.description: Disable Zeroconf automatic route assignment in the 169.254.0.0 subnet.

metadata.title: Disable Support for RPC IPv6
metadata.description: Disable ipv6 based rpc services

metadata.title: Disable the network sniffer
metadata.description: Disable the network sniffer

metadata.title: Direct root Logins Not Allowed
metadata.description: Preventing direct root logins help ensure accountability for actions taken on the system using the root account.

metadata.title: Ensure insecure_locks is disabled
metadata.description: Allowing insecure file locking could allow for sensitive data to be viewed or edited by an unauthorized user.

criterion.comment: Check for insecure NFS locks in /etc/exports

metadata.title: System Accounts Do Not Run a Shell
metadata.description: The root account is the only system account that should have a login shell.

criterion.comment: Test shell defined for UID from <0, UID_MIN -1>
Test shell defined for reserved system UIDs
Test shell defined for dynamically allocated system UIDs
